column3:
One complaint -- "remove sig_canonical.json and sig_noncanonical.json" commit description does not say _why_ it is being removed.  Needs more explanation.

Everything else:  ut ACK
@jgarzik see #5491 for the discussion/explanation about that\n

Binary analysis:

| Commit | Description | bitcoind hash |
| :-- | :-- | :-- |
| 6af674e | (parent) | 27eea9941bd3ebb9e8488331169f68e67008dbee95ea41f07fe6a45c305c5acf |
| 8673160 | Remove bootstrap.md | 27eea9941bd3ebb9e8488331169f68e67008dbee95ea41f07fe6a45c305c5acf |
| d6bed15 | remove sig_canonical.json and sig_noncanonical.json | ... |
| bfc29dc | Improve gitian build guide | 27eea9941b
This was missing the final resolution of #5730\n
Let's leave that for next trivial merge.\n

@jgarzik: I think that's actually a point worth addressing in the workflow. Ideally all changes would be explained, but often they depend on the original PR. For the next merge, I'll look into grabbing the PR description, since it won't necessarily be coming from the bitcoin repo.

@laanwj Thanks for the thorough review.
@jgarzik Sorry if I wasn't clear. By "grabbing the PR description", i meant adding it to the commit message so that nothing is lost when going upstream. I agree with you entirely.\n
Indeed, adding a link to the original pull request to the commit descriptions would make sense. I also do this when backporting to a branch.\n

s/link/description/

Can't assume GitHub will always be here.

Discussed this quickly on IRC. The issue is that I didn't demand a better commit message that can stand on its own for 'git log' purposes. Noted.

Edit: and obviously the PR link is a good idea regardless. I'll be doing that from now on as well.

@luke-jr If that's what you're afraid of, we have a mirror of all gh metadata (including issues and all discussions) for this repository here, thanks to @zw: https://github.com/zw/bitcoin-gh-meta  By keeping a local clone of that repository, we can keep everything backed up.\n
What is the sense here!? Are we now gendering the code?\n
@Diapolo It was prematurely ack'd. See the long discussion here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/5730 . It will be fixed.\n
Didn't take notice of the happening there... if it will be fixed I'm fine. It's likely better to not comment on the rest ^^.\n
